qas.question: When was the German Peasants' War?
What war was waged from 1618 to 1648?
How much was the German population reduced during the Thirty Years' War?
What treaty ended the Thirty Years' War?
Where was the German Peasants' War?

answers.text: the Bavarian, Thuringian and Swabian principalities

context: In the course of this religious upheaval, the German Peasants' War of <a0_0>1524–25<a0_0/> swept through <a4_0>the Bavarian, Thuringian and Swabian principalities<a4_0/>. After the Eighty Years' War in the Low Countries and the French Wars of Religion, the confessional division of the states of the Holy Roman Empire eventually erupted in <a1_0>the Thirty Years' War<a1_0/> between 1618 and 1648. It devastated much of Germany, killing <a2_0>between 25% and 40%<a2_0/> of its population. The main tenets of <a3_0>the Peace of Westphalia<a3_0/>, which ended the Thirty Years' War, were:
